page.title: 11LIFE-STYLES
page.content: It would be easy to imagine the local community being swamped by the tourist invasion,but this is far from true as a very strong sense of identity is maintained mainly by memberships of a myriad of clubs and orgaisations. Prominent amongst these are national groups like the Rotary, the Round Table which organises the November fireworks display , and Help the Aged which is particularly active with the numerous retirement homes like Chequers or Sunnybrae. The charitable instincts of the community are perhaps best seen by recent examples: the Tayside Body Scanner Appeal raised over Â£1500 from the school alone after a sponsored walk, while another Â£250 was raised by pupils for one of their fellows whose house was destroyed by fire.
